question.title: Will Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola does not announce a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must not be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must not specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If such a recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania carries out a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES determination, the following conditions must be satisfied:

3. The outcomes of the public vote must be disclosed through official state communications or reputable news outlets.

If no such public vote fulfilling these conditions takes place by August 31, 2024, the question will be answered as NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a public vote without actually holding it by the given date does not qualify for a YES determination.

question.title: Will Tennessee enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Tennessee enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for freight train operations by August 2024?

question.title: Given Union Pacific reaches a new agreement with the conductors' union on work schedule predictability, will they implement a new scheduling system for freight operations by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors. The agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets. The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors.

Then, will Union Pacific announce and implement a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations by the same date? The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. If no such system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does not specifically target schedule predictability for freight train operations, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Given Union Pacific does not reach a new agreement with the conductors' union on work schedule predictability, will they not implement a new scheduling system for freight operations by August 2024?
not_P.body:

The agreement must not be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and not reported by at least two major news outlets. The agreement should not directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors.

Then, will Union Pacific not announce and implement a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules less predictable for freight train operations by the same date? The implementation must not be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. The new system must not be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. If such a system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does specifically target schedule predictability for freight train operations, the question will resolve as YES.

question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

not_P.title: Will Illinois not hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?

The referendum must not be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must not be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must not directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if such a referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must not be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will there be a public vote in Illinois regarding healthcare reform before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, Illinois officially carries out a public vote that specifically aims to implement healthcare reform within the state. The vote must be formally declared by the Illinois Secretary of State or another relevant state election authority, and it must be arranged to occur on or before August 31, 2024. The question posed in the referendum must directly relate to healthcare reform. This inquiry will be answered with NO if no such vote is officially announced or executed by the designated date. It is important to note that simply collecting signatures for a potential referendum does not meet the criteria for a YES answer; the actual vote must be planned or conducted within the given timeframe.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania hold a referendum on renewable energy initiatives by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on implementing renewable energy initiatives in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on renewable energy initiatives.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum occurs or is completed by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Proposed referendums that have not been officially conducted by the resolution date do not count for a YES resolution.

2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on renewable energy initiatives.
3. The results of the referendum must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum occurs or is completed by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Proposed referendums that have been officially conducted by the resolution date count for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will no other U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan without a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, no U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that does not include a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must not be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be no official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must not be officially adopted, but merely proposed or under consideration. If at least one other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will there be another state in the U.S. that implements a Medicaid program requiring community engagement?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state, excluding Georgia, officially implements a Medicaid program that mandates community engagement for its beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be an essential part of the program. For a YES outcome, there needs to be an official declaration from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent coverage from a minimum of two credible national news outlets (like Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The program must be officially in place, not just proposed or being considered. If no other state establishes such a program by July 31, 2024, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

question.title: Will Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.body:

4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will California hold a referendum on gun control measures by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on gun control measures. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address gun control, either proposing to introduce new regulations or to relax existing ones. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on gun control does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will X's AI chatbot Grok be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that the AI chatbot Grok on the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) is spreading election misinformation. question.title: Will Alabama hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Alabama officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. question.title: Will a major South Korean battery company begin construction of a factory in Michigan by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, construction on a large-scale lithium-ion battery factory in Michigan, owned by a South Korean company, has officially commenced. question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the UK economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy enters a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

A recession is characterized for this question as experiencing two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as reported by the Office for National Statistics in the UK. Conversely, the question will be answered with a NO if the UK economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

para_P.title: IF Apple fails to conclude a union agreement with its store staff in Ohio by July 2024, will the House of Lords in the UK enact a significant economic reform legislation that is opposed by PM Sunak by August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By July 31, 2024, Apple has not concluded and officially endorsed a collective bargaining agreement with the unionized retail employees in Ohio. This indicates that there have been no official statements from Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or confirmations from at least two credible news outlets (like Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers) regarding the conclusion and endorsement of the agreement. This contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States.

Then, is it accurate to say that by August 31, 2024, the House of Lords in the United Kingdom will approve a significant economic reform bill that is clearly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his government? To qualify:

1. The legislation must pertain to economic policy, including fiscal expenditures, taxation, or monetary regulation.
2. It must receive approval from the House of Lords, irrespective of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his government must be distinctly reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The legislation must be characterized as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets in terms of its potential effect on the UK economy.

If no such legislation is approved by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is approved but does not satisfy all the aforementioned criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Satya Nadella on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Satya Nadella on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Satya Nadella must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Spotify announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% by August 2024?

The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 2% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if Spotify only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 2% reduction without announcing new cuts, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Reserve Bank of India and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the repo rate, which is the RBI's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be no concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the Italian economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Italy's economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not fall into a recession. A recession is characterized for this question as two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as indicated by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. Conversely, the answer will be NO if the Italian economy encounters two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

not_P.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure not show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) does not report a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The lack of such an increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If such an increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.title: Will there be a monthly rise in the Federal Reserve's favored inflation indicator that surpasses 0.5% by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if the Federal Reserve's favored inflation indicator (usually the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) indicates a month-over-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any single month from October 2023 through July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially announced by the Federal Reserve or a pertinent U.S. government agency (like the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such rise is documented during this timeframe, the inquiry will be deemed NO. It is important to note that this question pertains specifically to the month-over-month variation, rather than year-over-year or any other duration.

Then, can the Italian economy avoid entering a recession by July 31, 2024? 

For this question, the Italian economy is considered to have avoided a recession if it does not face two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics, at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. The outcome is YES if the Italian economy successfully avoids this recession, and NO if it does not.

Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Sergey Brin on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Sergey Brin must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

2. Elon Musk must not be the primary interviewer.
3. Sergey Brin must not be the interviewee.
4. The event must not be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must not be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. Fewer than two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If any of these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If all these conditions are met by this date, or if the interview does occur, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Mexican economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Mexican authorities officially declare the dismantling of the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel by July 2024?

question.title: Will the Philippine government enforce a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. The enforcement must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for a significant number of these trading platforms. 'Significant' in this context means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. If no such enforcement meeting these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

'Significant' in this context means less than 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must not be a result of government policy or directive, but due to voluntary closures or economic factors. question.title: Will California conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.body:

1. The vote must be officially announced and executed by the state of California.
2. The main concern of the vote must be the safeguarding of abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the vote must be publicly disclosed through official state communications or widely acknowledged news outlets.

If no such vote fulfilling these requirements occurs by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will resolve as negative. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a vote without actually carrying it out by the specified date does not qualify for an affirmative resolution.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. question.title: Will the Central Bank of Israel announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Israel officially announces a decrease in its interest rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Israel or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Israel members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will large protests occur in the United Kingdom in response to healthcare funding cuts by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in the United Kingdom specifically in response to the government's decision to cut healthcare funding. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across the United Kingdom. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of healthcare funding cuts. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the funding cuts are rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

The protests must not be explicitly linked to the issue of healthcare funding cuts. question.title: Will Google resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?

2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

Suppose the following is true: The Reserve Bank of Australia officially announces a decrease in its cash rate target by July 31, 2024. This announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of Australia or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Reserve Bank Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting.

Given this condition, will Washington's Medicaid expansion program enroll more than 450,000 residents by July 31, 2024? The enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The enrollment count refers to the total number of individuals newly covered under the Medicaid expansion program, not including those who were previously eligible for Medicaid.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will another U.S. state implement a 72-hour waiting period for voting registration by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, at least one additional U.S. state (other than Maine and those that already have such measures) implements a mandatory 72-hour waiting period for voting registration. The implementation must be confirmed through official state legislation or government announcements, and reported by at least two major national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, Fox News, or MSNBC). The waiting period must specifically be 72 hours; longer or shorter periods do not qualify. If no additional state adopts such a measure by the resolution date, or if the implementations are for different waiting periods, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the work requirement for Medicaid in Ohio be eliminated by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, Ohio's state government publicly declares the elimination of the work requirement from its Medicaid program. This change must be validated through official announcements from the state or reported by at least two prominent news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement pertains to the stipulation that beneficiaries must be employed or participate in other qualifying activities to obtain Medicaid benefits. If no such declaration occurs by the resolution date, or if the work requirement persists, the inquiry will resolve as negative.

question.title: Given Ohio removes the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024, will another U.S. state implement a 72-hour waiting period for voting registration by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the state of Ohio officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan, confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations. The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits.

Then, is it true that by August 31, 2024, at least one additional U.S. state (other than Maine and those that already have such measures) implements a mandatory 72-hour waiting period for voting registration? The implementation must be confirmed through official state legislation or government announcements, and reported by at least two major national news outlets. The waiting period must specifically be 72 hours; longer or shorter periods do not qualify.

not_P.title: Given Ohio does not remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024, will no other U.S. state implement a 72-hour waiting period for voting registration by August 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the state of Ohio does not officially announce the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan, confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations. The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits.

Then, is it true that by August 31, 2024, no additional U.S. state (other than Maine and those that already have such measures) implements a mandatory 72-hour waiting period for voting registration? The implementation must be confirmed through official state legislation or government announcements, and reported by at least two major national news outlets. The waiting period must specifically be 72 hours; longer or shorter periods do not qualify.

para_P.title: If Ohio eliminates the work requirement from its Medicaid program by July 2024, will any other U.S. state establish a 72-hour waiting period for voter registration by August 2024?

Then, is it accurate to say that by August 31, 2024, at least one more U.S. state (excluding Maine and those that already have such policies) will have enacted a compulsory 72-hour waiting period for voter registration? This enactment must be validated through official state legislation or government communications, and covered by at least two major national news outlets. The waiting period must be exactly 72 hours; any longer or shorter durations do not meet the criteria.

question.title: Given Ohio keeps the work requirement in its Medicaid plan through July 2024, will another U.S. state implement a 72-hour waiting period for voting registration by August 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two separate policy developments in the United States.

Suppose the following is true: Ohio keeps the work requirement in its Medicaid plan through July 2024. This means that by July 31, 2024, the state of Ohio has not officially announced the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. If the work requirement remains in place, or if no official state announcements or reports by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers) confirm the removal, then the condition is met.

Given the above condition, we are interested in whether another U.S. state implements a 72-hour waiting period for voting registration by August 2024. This will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, at least one additional U.S. state (other than Maine and those that already have such measures) implements a mandatory 72-hour waiting period for voting registration. The implementation must be confirmed through official state legislation or government announcements, and reported by at least two major national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, Fox News, or MSNBC). The waiting period must specifically be 72 hours; longer or shorter periods do not qualify. If no additional state adopts such a measure by the resolution date, or if the implementations are for different waiting periods, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. previously occupied home sales increase for three consecutive months by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are three consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show an increase compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The increases must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly increases are reported by the resolution date, or if only one or two months show an increase, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will U.S. previously occupied home sales not increase for three consecutive months by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are no three consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show an increase compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The increases must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If such consecutive monthly increases are reported by the resolution date, or if three or more months show an increase, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be a rise in sales of previously owned homes in the U.S. for three straight months by July 2024?

The increases should be reported as seasonally adjusted annual rates. If there are no such consecutive monthly increases reported by the resolution date, or if only one or two months show an increase, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Will Medicare's negotiated drug prices include a major cholesterol medication by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the newly negotiated drug prices for Medicare, as mentioned in the Biden administration's announcement, include a major cholesterol medication and are confirmed to take effect by August 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another relevant U.S. government agency. The inclusion of the medication must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). If the medication is not included in the negotiated prices by this date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the lawsuit against Massachusetts' initiative on crisis pregnancy centers be ongoing in August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the lawsuit filed by a conservative law firm against Massachusetts' initiative targeting crisis pregnancy centers is still ongoing in court. The status of the lawsuit must be confirmed through official court documents or reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the lawsuit has been dismissed, settled, or reached a final judgment by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'ongoing' means the case is still in active litigation, including any appeals process.

question.title: Will Alabama enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Alabama enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Alabama not enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?

No stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, no additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Alabama introduce more stringent abortion regulations than those applicable to other healthcare services by July 2024?

More stringent requirements may encompass, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards that are unique to abortion providers. If no such statutes or regulations are put in place by the resolution date, or if any laws or regulations that are enacted are uniformly applied to all healthcare services, the inquiry will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will the Washington Lottery offer online products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Washington Lottery has officially launched any of its products for online purchase or play. Confirmation must come from an official announcement by the Washington Lottery or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as local Washington newspapers, national news outlets, or industry-specific publications). The online products must be accessible to the general public within Washington and allow for real-money transactions. Beta testing phases or limited rollouts to select groups do not qualify for a YES resolution. If the Washington Lottery does not offer online products meeting these criteria by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Washington Lottery not offer online products by July 2024?

The online products must not be accessible to the general public within Washington and must not allow for real-money transactions. Beta testing phases or limited rollouts to select groups do not qualify for a NO resolution. If the Washington Lottery offers online products meeting these criteria by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Washington Lottery provide online offerings before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by July 31, 2024, the Washington Lottery has officially introduced any of its offerings for online purchase or participation. Beta testing phases or restricted launches to specific groups do not qualify for a TRUE resolution. If the Washington Lottery fails to provide online offerings that meet these standards by July 31, 2024, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE.

question.title: Will Google resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Google reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Google workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Google not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if Google does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Google workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as YES.

para_P.title: Will Google come to an agreement to end a significant labor strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if Google successfully negotiates with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For the answer to be deemed valid:

1. The strike must engage a considerable number of Google employees (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must continue for a minimum duration of one week.
3. The conclusion must be validated by official announcements from both Google and the relevant union.
4. The conclusion must be reported by at least two credible international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such agreement that fulfills all these conditions is reached by the given date, or if no significant strike takes place, the question will be answered as NO.

question.title: Conditional on Google resolving a major workers' strike by July 2024, will the Washington Lottery offer online products by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Google reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The question resolves as NO if the French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Colorado has not officially implemented a free community college plan. Implementation is considered not to have occurred if students are not able to enroll in community colleges without tuition fees, or if such implementation is not reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as local Colorado newspapers, national news outlets, or official state government announcements). The plan must be part of a state-wide initiative, not limited to specific institutions or pilot programs. 

Then, will BNSF Railway and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors by August 31, 2024? The agreement must be officially confirmed by both BNSF Railway and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If no such agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced agreement does not specifically address work schedule predictability, the question will resolve as NO.

For the implementation to be deemed absent, it must be the case that students cannot enroll in community colleges without incurring tuition costs, or such implementation must not be reported by a minimum of two credible news organizations (including local Colorado newspapers, national media, or official announcements from the state government). The initiative should be part of a comprehensive state program, rather than being confined to certain institutions or trial programs. 

Consequently, will BNSF Railway and the union representing train conductors make a public declaration of a new agreement that specifically focuses on enhancing work schedule predictability for conductors by August 31, 2024? This agreement must receive official endorsement from both BNSF Railway and the union and be reported by at least two prominent news agencies (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or leading national newspapers). The agreement should directly tackle the matter of improving schedule predictability for train conductors, as highlighted in the ongoing negotiations. If no such agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if any announced agreement fails to specifically address work schedule predictability, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current Zika virus outbreak over by August 2024?

question.title: Will Minnesota hold a referendum on housing affordability by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Minnesota officially conducts a referendum regarding housing affordability. The referendum must be a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing housing affordability. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If no such referendum is held by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only concerns the occurrence of the referendum itself, not its outcome.

question.title: Will Tim Scott publicly retract his statement about Biden's stance on criminal justice reform?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Tim Scott publicly retracts or significantly alters his statement regarding Joe Biden's position on criminal justice reform. The retraction or alteration must be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). A significant alteration would involve a substantial change to the core message of his original statement, not just a minor clarification or rewording. If no such retraction or significant alteration is reported by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'publicly' means through official statements, interviews, social media posts from verified accounts, or during public appearances.

question.title: Will Alibaba Group resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Alibaba Group reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Alibaba Group workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as YES.

question.title: Will large protests occur in Indonesia in response to religious freedom legislation by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in Indonesia specifically in response to new religious freedom legislation. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Indonesia. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of religious freedom legislation. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the legislation is rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the World Bank announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the World Bank officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. question.title: Will Spain's IBEX 35 index reach or exceed 10,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points. The 10,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Bolsa de Madrid. If the index does not reach 10,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 10,000 points.

not_P.title: Will Spain's IBEX 35 index not reach or exceed 10,000 points by August 2024?

question.title: Will the NFL settle the 'Sunday Ticket' antitrust case for less than $4.7 billion by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if by July 31, 2024, the NFL reaches a settlement in the 'Sunday Ticket' antitrust case for an amount less than $4,707,259,944. question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will the German economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the German economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The question resolves as NO if the German economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Facebook's AI content moderation system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Facebook's AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. question.title: Will the European Commission implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the European Commission officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The implementation must be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. If no such tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the European Commission not implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the European Commission does not officially implement a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The implementation must not be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and not reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must not be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China or be part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. If such a tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is the European Commission set to enforce a substantial duty on solar panels produced in China by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by August 31, 2024, the European Commission officially enacts a duty of 50% or more on the importation of solar panels made in China. The enforcement must be validated by official announcements from the European Commission and covered by at least two prominent news organizations (like Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The duty must specifically target solar panels that are manufactured in China and not be part of a wider duty on all goods from China or all electronic items. If no such duty that meets these requirements is put into effect by the given date, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given the European Commission implements a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels, will Google reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, the European Commission officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels, confirmed by official announcements and at least two major news outlets. The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods.

Then, is the following true: By August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations, confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources. The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. Appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Given the European Commission implements a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels, will Google not reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, the European Commission officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels, confirmed by official announcements and at least two major news outlets. The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods.

Then, is the following true: By August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority do not reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations, confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources. The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. Appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: If the European Commission enacts a substantial tariff on solar panels produced in China, will Google come to an agreement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: By August 31, 2024, the European Commission officially enacts a tariff of 50% or greater on the importation of solar panels made in China, as confirmed by official announcements and at least two major news outlets. The tariff must be explicitly aimed at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a wider tariff affecting all Chinese products or all electronic goods.

Then, is the following statement accurate: By August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority finalize a formal settlement concerning a fine levied against Google for purported data protection infractions, as confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two credible news outlets. The settlement must specifically pertain to the fine imposed on Google by the UK authority. Appeals, ongoing discussions, or partial agreements do not qualify for a YES answer.

question.title: Conditional on the European Commission refraining from implementing a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels, will Google reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, the European Commission does not officially implement a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The absence of such a tariff must be confirmed by the lack of official European Commission announcements and the absence of reports by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods.

Then, is the following true? By August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If no such settlement is reached or publicly confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Conditional on the European Commission implementing a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels, will Google not reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
not_P.body:
