para_P.title: If the European Commission does not impose a substantial tariff on solar panels from China, will Google finalize an agreement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By August 31, 2024, the European Commission has not officially enacted a tariff of 50% or more on imports of solar panels produced in China. This lack of a tariff must be verified by the absence of any formal announcements from the European Commission and the lack of coverage by at least two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically aimed at solar panels made in China and not part of a larger tariff affecting all Chinese imports or all electronic products.

Then, is it accurate to say that by August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority will have reached a formal settlement concerning a penalty imposed on Google for alleged violations of data protection laws? This settlement must be validated by official communications from either party or reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or prominent national newspapers). The settlement should specifically relate to the penalty imposed by the UK authority on Google. If no such settlement is achieved or publicly acknowledged by the specified date, the answer will be NO. Keep in mind that appeals, ongoing discussions, or partial agreements do not count as a YES outcome.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remain at or above 13.25% in August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate be below 13.25% in August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be below 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have remained at or above 13.25% throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Brazil's Central Bank maintain the Selic rate at or exceeding 13.25% throughout August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, during August 2024, the Selic rate set by Brazil's Central Bank is documented to be at or above 13.25% at any time. Verification must be sourced from official announcements by the Central Bank of Brazil or at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Folha de S.Paulo). Conversely, if the rate is reported to fall below 13.25% and stays below this threshold for the entirety of August 2024, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike through August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

not_P.title: Will Argentine agricultural workers not remain on strike through August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are not still on strike or have fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have not fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

para_P.title: Will agricultural laborers in Argentina continue their strike until August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by the end of August 2024, agricultural laborers in Argentina are still striking or have not completely returned to regular operations after any ongoing labor conflict. The confirmation of the strike status or the resumption of work must come from official announcements made by agricultural organizations, the unions that represent the workers, or the Argentine government, and should be reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have entirely resumed their duties and normal operations are back to usual before or during August 2024, the answer will be NO. Any partial return to work or restricted operations will not be considered a complete resolution of the strike.

question.title: Will a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio be canceled by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

not_P.title: Will a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio not be canceled by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio has not been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The project must still be ongoing, under review, or not officially canceled by this date. For the purpose of this question, 'not canceled' means the company has not formally withdrawn its plans or the state has not definitively rejected the project.

para_P.title: Is the factory initiative of a South Korean battery manufacturer in Ohio going to be scrapped by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is verified that the South Korean lithium-ion battery manufacturer's intention to establish a factory in Ohio has been officially abandoned. Verification must be obtained from official announcements by the company, the state of Ohio, or a minimum of two reliable news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or prominent national newspapers). The abandonment must represent a total cessation of the project, rather than a mere postponement or alteration. If the project remains in progress, is under consideration, or has not been officially abandoned by this date, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. In the context of this question, 'abandonment' signifies that the company has officially retracted its plans or that the state has unequivocally dismissed the project.

question.title: Will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points. The 3,500 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. If the index does not reach 3,500 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points.

not_P.title: Will South Korea's KOSPI index not reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024?

question.title: Will Andrew Bailey remain as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Andrew Bailey is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of England on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Bailey remaining in the position.

not_P.title: Will Andrew Bailey not remain as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if Andrew Bailey is no longer serving as the Governor of the Bank of England on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is still serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Bailey remaining in the position.

para_P.title: Is Andrew Bailey going to continue as the Governor of the Bank of England until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if Andrew Bailey is still in the role of Governor of the Bank of England on July 31, 2024. Verification must be sourced from official announcements by the Bank of England or reported by a minimum of two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:

2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Australian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Australian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the Australian economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian economy does enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Australian economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Australia steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the Australian economy remains free from recession by July 31, 2024. For this context, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as documented by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. Conversely, the answer will be NO if the Australian economy encounters two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will U.S. previously occupied home sales show a decline for two consecutive months by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are two consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show a decline compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The declines must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly declines are reported by the resolution date, or if only a single month shows a decline, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Apple fund full tuition for all Caltech physics students by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is officially confirmed that Apple's funding is being used to cover full tuition for all physics students at Caltech, regardless of their family income. question.title: Will Facebook resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Facebook reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Facebook workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Facebook and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Facebook not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if Facebook does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Facebook workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Facebook and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as YES.

para_P.title: Will Facebook come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if Facebook successfully negotiates with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For the answer to be deemed valid:

1. The strike must include a considerable number of Facebook employees (no fewer than 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must continue for a minimum duration of one week.
3. The conclusion must be verified through official announcements from both Facebook and the respective union.
4. The outcome must be covered by at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these stipulations is not reached by the given deadline, or if no major strike takes place, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?

If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

question.title: Will the Indonesian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Indonesia. The question resolves as NO if the Indonesian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

Then, will the state of Michigan not enact a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 31, 2024? The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local Michigan news stations). The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in Michigan. If such a law is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted law does modify the current restrictions, the question resolves as YES.

para_P.body:

Then, will the state of Michigan enact a new statute that modifies or supersedes the current limitations on medical treatment for transgender youth by July 31, 2024? The new statute must specifically address and amend the existing limitations on medical treatment for transgender youth in Michigan. If no such statute is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted statute does not alter the current limitations, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will South Dakota hold a referendum on environmental policies by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, South Dakota officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of environmental policies. The referendum must be related to implementing significant changes in the state's environmental regulations or policies. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the South Dakota state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Brazil officially announces a decrease in its Selic rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Brazil or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee (COPOM) and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Brazil members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will New Jersey hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, New Jersey officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the New Jersey state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major New Jersey-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in New Jersey and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. question.title: Will Brazil's Bovespa index reach or exceed 130,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index reaches or exceeds 130,000 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3 (Brasil Bolsa Balcão). question.title: Will the Central Bank of Indonesia announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the BI 7-day reverse repo rate, which is the Central Bank of Indonesia's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Russia's Federation Council not pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia's Federation Council does not pass a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must not be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must not be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must not be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must not be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If such a bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed that meets all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

4. The bill must be characterized as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets regarding its potential influence on the Russian economy.

If no such legislation is approved by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is approved but does not fulfill all the aforementioned criteria, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will a major oil spill occur in the Beaufort Sea by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there is a confirmed major oil spill in the Beaufort Sea resulting from any tanker attacked by a regional militant group. A major oil spill is defined as a spill that is reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, AP, BBC, or Al Jazeera) and causes significant environmental damage, requiring large-scale cleanup efforts. The spill must be directly linked to an attack by a regional militant group on a tanker in the Beaufort Sea. If no such spill occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will France's weekly jobless claims exceed 200,000 for three consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in France, as reported by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies, exceeds 200,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies will be considered.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces a decrease in its bank rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Bank of England or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoE members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Bank of England not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?

question.title: Will New York City announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city government of New York City officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must come from an official source within New York City's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the median Canadian home price reach a new record high by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the median price of existing homes sold in Canada reaches a new record high, surpassing any previous monthly median price on record. The record must be confirmed by data from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other widely recognized real estate data providers such as Royal LePage or RE/MAX. The median price refers to the middle price in the range of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half sold for less. If no new record high is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported median price does not exceed the current record, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question focuses on the nominal price, not adjusted for inflation.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Russia or a relevant Russian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, TASS). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Elvira Nabiullina is still serving as the Governor of the Central Bank of Russia on July 31, 2024. question.title: Will General Motors resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if General Motors reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of General Motors workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both General Motors and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Russia report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this question, 'successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being at least 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season does not meet these criteria, or if insufficient data is available to make a determination, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Russia not report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia does not report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields not meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The lack of success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or by fewer than three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this question, 'not successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being less than 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season meets these criteria, or if sufficient data is available to make a determination, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Russia announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Russian government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement must come from an official government source, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announcement only reaffirms or provides updates on the existing two-reactor plan, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Russia will declare intentions to construct more nuclear reactors in addition to the current two by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Russian authorities formally declare intentions to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the two currently in the pipeline. The declaration must originate from an official government entity, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and be covered by at least two prominent international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The statement must explicitly express a desire to develop extra reactors beyond the two already planned, rather than merely discussing expansions or alterations to the existing plans. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the declaration merely reaffirms or updates the current two-reactor plan, the inquiry will conclude as NO.

question.title: Conditional on Russia announcing plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024, will Russia report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the Russian government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement comes from an official government source, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and is reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement clearly indicates an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans.

Given this condition, will Russia report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 31, 2024? This will resolve as YES if Russia reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). 'Successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being at least 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season does not meet these criteria, or if insufficient data is available to make a determination, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Conditional on Russia announcing plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024, will Russia not report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the Russian government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement comes from an official government source, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and is reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement clearly indicates an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans.

Given this condition, will Russia not report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 31, 2024? This will resolve as YES if Russia does not report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields not meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must not be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). 'Not successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being at least 5% below the five-year average. If the winter crop season meets these criteria, or if sufficient data is available to make a determination, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If Russia declares intentions to construct more nuclear reactors in addition to the existing two by July 2024, will the country announce a fruitful winter harvest for wheat and barley by August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: By July 31, 2024, the Russian government publicly reveals plans to develop further nuclear reactors beyond the two currently in the works. This announcement should originate from a credible government entity, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and be covered by at least two significant international news organizations (like Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The statement must clearly express a commitment to build additional reactors beyond the two already planned, rather than simply altering or enhancing the current proposals.

Under this premise, will Russia disclose a prosperous winter harvest for wheat and barley by August 31, 2024? The outcome will be YES if Russia announces a successful winter harvest for wheat and barley, defined by yields that meet or surpass the average from the past five years. This success must be validated by official agricultural data from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). 'Successful' is defined as the total output of wheat and barley being at least 5% greater than the five-year average. If the winter harvest does not satisfy these conditions, or if there is inadequate data to reach a conclusion, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given Russia does not announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024, will Russia report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the Russian government does not officially announce plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. This means no official announcement comes from sources like the Kremlin or Rosatom, reported by major international news outlets, indicating an intention to construct additional reactors. If no such announcement is made, or if only existing plans are reaffirmed, this condition is met.

Then, is it true that by August 31, 2024, Russia will report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years? A successful season is defined as production being at least 5% above the five-year average, confirmed by official statistics or reputable news sources. If these criteria are met, the outcome resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Given Russia does announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024, will Russia not report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
not_P.body:

If such an announcement is made, or if existing plans are not reaffirmed, this condition is met.

Then, is it true that by August 31, 2024, Russia will not report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields not meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years? If these criteria are not met, the outcome resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Assuming that Russia does not make any declarations regarding the construction of additional nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned by July 2024, will there be a report of a successful winter harvest for wheat and barley in Russia by August 2024?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the scenario where, by July 31, 2024, the Russian government has not made any formal announcements about building more nuclear reactors beyond the two already in the pipeline. This implies that no official communication from entities such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, as reported by major international media, indicates any intention to develop further reactors. The condition is satisfied if no such announcements are made or if only the existing plans are reiterated.

In that case, can we determine that by August 31, 2024, Russia will declare a successful winter harvest for wheat and barley, defined by yields that meet or surpass the average from the last five years? A successful harvest is characterized by production being at least 5% above the five-year average, validated by official statistics or credible news outlets. If these conditions are fulfilled, the answer will be YES; otherwise, it will be NO.

question.title: Will the United Nations Development Programme announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the United Nations Development Programme not announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme does not officially announce one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must not be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and not be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must not be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, and must not be continuations of previously announced commitments. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the United Nations Development Programme will declare new funding pledges exceeding $400 million by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme makes an official declaration of one or more new funding pledges that together surpass $400 million. The declaration(s) must be issued through official UNDP channels (like their website or press releases) and be covered by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding pledges must represent new initiatives or substantial expansions of current programs, not merely continuations of previously announced pledges. If no such declaration occurs by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding pledges does not exceed $400 million, the inquiry will resolve as negative.

question.title: Will a major hospital system in France cancel over €250 million in medical debt by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in France, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple regions. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is €250 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will a major hospital system in France not cancel over €250 million in medical debt by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in France, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, does not successfully cancel more than €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple regions. The cancellation must not be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should not target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is more than €250 million, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a significant healthcare network in France to eliminate more than €250 million in medical debt by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, a healthcare network located in France, in partnership with a charitable organization, manages to eliminate over €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients in various regions. The debt cancellation must be publicly declared by the healthcare network or reported by a minimum of two major news organizations (including Le Monde, Reuters, or other prominent national publications). The cancellation should focus on patients who are financially disadvantaged or unable to afford payment. If the debt cancellation is not finalized or officially acknowledged by the designated date, or if the total amount cancelled is €250 million or less, the inquiry will be considered negative.

question.title: Will Arizona hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Arizona officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Arizona state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Arizona-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Arizona and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

not_P.title: Will Arizona not hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Arizona does not officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must not be formally announced by the Arizona state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Arizona-based news outlets). The referendum must not be open to all eligible voters in Arizona or must not focus primarily on abortion rights. If such a referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is not canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

The vote must be accessible to all qualified voters in Arizona and primarily address abortion rights. If such a vote does not take place or is not finalized by the resolution date, or if the vote is canceled or delayed beyond July 31, 2024, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. Please note that this question focuses solely on the occurrence of the vote, not its results.

question.title: Will Wisconsin's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Wisconsin's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Wisconsin state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will LG Electronics resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if LG Electronics reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of LG Electronics workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both LG Electronics and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will LG Electronics not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:

2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both LG Electronics and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as YES.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 30-year mortgage in the US fall below 6.2% by August 2024?

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in New York City by August 2024?

question.title: Will Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. workers (at least 1,000 participants).

4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of the Philippines officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). question.body:

3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

question.title: Will Nigeria's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Nigeria's Senate not pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate does not pass a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must not be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must not be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must not be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must not be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If such a bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed that meets all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Nigerian Senate approve a significant economic reform legislation that President Tinubu is against by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Nigerian Senate approves a significant economic reform legislation that President Bola Tinubu or his administration has explicitly opposed. To qualify:

1. The legislation must pertain to economic policy, such as fiscal expenditures, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be approved by the Senate, irrespective of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The legislation must be characterized as 'significant' or 'major' by these news outlets concerning its potential effect on the Nigerian economy.

If no such legislation is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a legislation is passed but does not fulfill all the aforementioned criteria, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Bayer allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Bayer officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Bayer continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Bayer not allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Bayer does not officially announce or confirm that it will allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug, effectively enforcing its patent. This could be through a continued enforcement of its patent rights, no voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that restricts generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers) indicating that Bayer is maintaining its patent rights. If such an announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Bayer allows generic production, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Bayer permit the creation of generic versions of its heart medication by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by July 31, 2024, Bayer makes an official announcement or confirmation that it will permit the creation of generic versions of its heart medication, thereby not enforcing its patent rights. This could occur through a formal withdrawal of the patent, a voluntary licensing agreement, or any other method that facilitates unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must be derived from official announcements from the company, statements from pertinent regulatory authorities, or reports from at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified deadline, or if Bayer continues to uphold its patent rights, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Bayer officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. Then, will Nigeria's Senate pass a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration by August 31, 2024? To qualify:

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A. If the condition is met, the question resolves as YES if such a bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, and NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Conditional on Bayer not allowing generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 2024, will Nigeria's Senate not pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
not_P.body:

This could be through a formal patent retention, a refusal of a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that does not allow for unrestricted generic production. question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage in the US fall below 5.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 5.0% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not fall below 5.0% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 5.0% will not be considered as falling below 5.0%.

not_P.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage in the US not fall below 5.0% by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, does not fall below 5.0% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate falls below 5.0% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 5.0% will be considered as not falling below 5.0%.

para_P.title: Will the average interest rate on a 15-year mortgage in the United States drop below 5.0% before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average interest rate on a 15-year fixed mortgage in the US, as indicated by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, dips below 5.0% at any moment. The rate must be validated by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two credible financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not decrease below 5.0% by the given date, or if Freddie Mac stops reporting this figure, the inquiry will be marked as NO. For clarification, a rate of precisely 5.0% will not be regarded as dropping below 5.0%.

question.title: Will Jerome Powell remain as Federal Reserve Chair through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Jerome Powell is still serving as the Chair of the Federal Reserve on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Federal Reserve announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Chair by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Chair appointments will not be considered as Powell remaining in the position.

not_P.title: Will Jerome Powell not remain as Federal Reserve Chair through July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if Jerome Powell is no longer serving as the Chair of the Federal Reserve on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Federal Reserve announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is still serving as Chair by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to continuing in position, reappointment, or extension of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Chair appointments will not be considered as Powell remaining in the position.

para_P.title: Is Jerome Powell set to continue as the Chair of the Federal Reserve until July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if Jerome Powell is still in the role of Federal Reserve Chair on July 31, 2024. If he is no longer in the position of Chair by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or completion of term), the inquiry resolves as NO. For the purposes of this question, any interim or acting Chair appointments will not be counted as Powell continuing in the role.

question.title: Will Colorado's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Colorado's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Colorado state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

not_P.title: Will Colorado's near-total abortion ban not be declared constitutional by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms that Colorado's near-total abortion ban is unconstitutional. The confirmation must come from a Colorado state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it constitutional, the question resolves as NO. para_P.title: By August 2024, will a court affirm the constitutionality of Colorado's near-total abortion prohibition?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, a judicial decision verifies the constitutionality of Colorado's near-total abortion prohibition. The affirmation must originate from a Colorado state court and be covered by at least two credible national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or prominent US newspapers). If the prohibition is not affirmed as constitutional by the given date, or if a court determines it to be unconstitutional, the inquiry will be resolved as NO. In this context, a 'near-total abortion prohibition' pertains to the law that was halted and is awaiting evaluation, as referenced in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will Rhode Island maintain its red flag law through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, Rhode Island continues to enforce a red flag law as part of its gun safety laws. The resolution will be based on official state regulations or announcements from Rhode Island's government, confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Rhode Island news outlets). question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Virginia's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, has enrolled at least 25,000 low-income residents. The plan must maintain its work requirement feature throughout the period. If the enrollment is below 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is removed from the plan, the question resolves as NO. In case of any legal challenges or federal interventions that significantly alter the plan's structure or implementation, the question will still resolve based on the enrollment numbers of the original plan or its closest equivalent.

question.title: Will Apple Inc. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Apple Inc. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Apple Inc. workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Apple Inc. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Virginia maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Will IBM lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, IBM has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If IBM confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

not_P.title: Will IBM not lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, IBM has not confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must not come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must not be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If IBM confirms a number of layoffs that is 1,800 or more, or if such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Confirmation of partial layoffs or phased implementations that do reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a YES resolution.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, IBM has officially acknowledged the termination of at least 1,800 staff members as part of its reorganization strategy focused on AI. Confirmation must be derived from official announcements by the company, regulatory documents, or reports from a minimum of two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The terminations must be directly associated with the AI-centered reorganization strategy introduced in 2023. If IBM verifies a lower count of terminations, or if no confirmation meeting these stipulations is provided by the resolution date, the inquiry will be resolved in the negative. Any partial terminations or gradual implementations that do not meet the 1,800 employee benchmark by the resolution date will also lead to a negative resolution.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a mental health support requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a mental health support requirement for beneficiaries. question.title: Will Tennessee conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Tennessee conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Tennessee.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

not_P.body:

1. The referendum must not be officially announced and conducted by the state of Tennessee.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Tennessee holds a public vote specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES outcome, the following conditions need to be satisfied:

1. The vote must be officially announced and carried out by the state of Tennessee.
2. The main focus of the vote must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The results of the vote must be made public through official state channels or widely recognized news outlets.

If no such vote that meets these conditions takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. It is important to note that simply proposing or planning a vote without actually executing it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES outcome.

question.title: Will the Indian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?

The question will be answered with YES if the Indian economy does not undergo two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024. Conversely, it will be NO if the Indian economy does face two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth during this timeframe.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 31, 2024. question.title: Will the Bahraini health ministry confirm more than one case of polio in Manama by August 2024?
question.body:

1. Confirmation must come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements.
2. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
3. The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023.
4. Only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered.
5. The type of polio (wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) does not matter for this question.

If no additional cases beyond the first are confirmed by the specified date, or if only one case in total is confirmed, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Minnesota hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Minnesota officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Minnesota state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will the WHO declare the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, not a global Lassa fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Lassa fever that does not specifically address the Nigerian outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

2. This declaration must not be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must not specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, but rather to a global Lassa fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO makes such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Lassa fever that specifically addresses the Nigerian outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak.

2. This announcement must be covered by at least two prominent international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The statement must specifically mention the Nigerian Lassa fever situation, rather than a general global context of Lassa fever.

The inquiry will conclude with NO if:
1. The WHO does not issue such a statement by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO releases a statement regarding Lassa fever that does not specifically pertain to the Nigerian situation.

Note: If the WHO has previously declared the Nigerian Lassa fever situation to be no longer a global emergency before the start date of this inquiry, the resolution will still be based on the status as of August 31, 2024.
